page.title: 02From the Past.
page.content: The{Roman Fosse Way}passes close to Moreton Morrell - there is no evidence of any settlement from that period. In{Saxon}times there were two villages one named Moreton the other Merhull, which means boundary hill. There is an entry for the village of Moreton Morrell in the{Domesday Book {of 1086. Ashorne is believed to have developed as a result of the{"Great Plague"}of the 1660's coming to the village of Newbold Pacey and the people crossing the water of the narrow Woozeley Brook in the hope of escaping death. Evidence of this may be that the village church is at Newbold Pacey. The {Church of the Holy Cross, Moreton {Morrell,}was a Chantry Chapel to Moreton Hall. The altar dates from the 1580's. In the churchyard is a Norman gateway.
